name: Greece
takeaway: While Chinese influence in the academic sphere is perhaps not deep, it is broad, as reflected in the extensive formal cooperation between Greek and Chinese universities, which provides a basis for potential future deepening of Chinese influence in this area.

The penetration of Chinese infuence is perhap greatest at the societal level, as reflected in the Index data. Beijing appears to have had some success in projecting a relationship of friendship and fraternity between the two peoples in an effort promote a positive image of China in the Greek society.

Finaly, Greek Domestic Politicis and Economy seem to be targeted by the PRC. Indicators suggest that there is a gradual Chinese approach toward local Greek government institutions and small innovation companies (start-ups), potentially part of a wider strategy of increasing the PRC presence in Greece to promote its economic interests.
description-1: In 2023, Greece had a GDP per capita of US$22,990 and a total population of 10.35 million people.
description-2: Greece established diplomatic relations with the People’s Republic of China in 1972. Greece was ranked 88th in Reporters Without Borders 2024 World Press Freedom Index, and rated Free in Freedom House‘s 2024 Global Freedom Index, with a score of 85/100.

Media.evidence: The only Chinese media in Greece is the China Greece Times, an online weekly newspaper, present on Facebook, X, Weibo, WeChat, Instagram and YouTube. The media outlet is a part of the World Chinese Media, having participated in World Chinese Media events and courses from 2007 to 2019. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. Yet China Greece Times has practicly no appeal to local audiences and is almost unknown. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: There has been one reported case of participation in international travel organized by the PRC, by the Greek inluencers Marianna and Sofia Erotokritou. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Few" rating. The two are fluent speakers of the Chinese language, have studied in China, are occupied with Chinese social media, and are deemed ambassadors of the Greek tourism in China. However, for the time being, they are only active in tourism promotion. Therefore, this indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: China Greece Times is theonly reported Chinese online newspaper that was founded in Athens, Greece in 2005 by the local Chinese Community. Additionally, there is one case of a Greek businessman, namely Evangelos Marinakis, who owns the Greek newspapers "To Vima" and "Ta Nea", and he Greek TV channel "Mega", that has significant shipbuilding interests in China. Therefore, this indicatoe deserves a "Few" rating. However, Marinakis has extensive influence and active presence in the Port of Piraeus Authority, majority owned by the Chinese state-company COSCO. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Media.evidence: The prominent Greek newspaper Kathimerini and the AMNA News Agency, signed cooperation agreements for content exchange with Xinhua in 2017, while the smaller local newspaper "Amarysia" cooperates with Xinhua since 1999. Social media outlets have also delivered such content, such as the Facebook page of Greece-China Radio, the Facebook page of China Radio International, or the website of CRI-Greece. Additionally, the Greek newspaper "Naftemporiki", signed a cooperation agreement with Chinese Economic Daily that includes content sharing. Therefore this indicator deserves a "More than a few" rating. Most of the aforementioned media outlets, namely "Kathimerini", "Naftemporiki" and AMNA, are widely read media within and outside Greece, in both the Greek and the English language. Therefore this indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Media.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: According to the Greek Ministry of Foreign Affairs, in 2006 Greece and China upgraded their relations to a Comprehensive Strategic Partnership. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon. According to the Greek Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Greece adheres to the "OneChina" policy, along with the overwhelming majority of the international community, including all Member-States of the European Union. Greece recognizes only the People’s Republic of China as a country and does not have diplomatic relations with Taiwan/Chinese Taipei. A “Taipei Representation Office” was established in Athens in 1972, and remaines active since, without any diplomatic or consular status. Greece has not declared, officially or otherwise, Taiwan as an inalienable part of China.
Foreign Policy.note: It should be noted, however, that in the "Joint Statement Between the People's Republic of China and the Hellenic Republic on Strengthening the Comprehensive Strategic Partnership" in 2019, Greece accepted (possibly as a courtesy to Chinese President Xi Jinping who was an honored guest in Athens at the time of the statement) the common document, which mentions at some point that "Greece reaffirmed its commitment to the one-China principle, its respect for China’s sovereignty and territorial integrity and its support for the unification of China" (https://www.mfa.gr/en/current-affairs/statements-speeches/joint-statement-between-the-peoples-republic-of-china-and-the-hellenic-republic-on-strengthening-the-comprehensive-strategic-partnership-athens-1111-2019-2.html). Still, the official Greek position adheres to the "one China policy", not the "one China principle".
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Foreign Policy.evidence: No evidence can be found of the Index country taking a definitive position regarding this Indicator. Therefore, the Index country has remained silent regarding the PRC’s territorial claim and the Indicator warrants a 2 score.

Foreign Policy.evidence: No evidence can be found of Greece taking a definitive position regarding this Indicator. Therefore, Greece has remained silent regarding the PRC’s treatment of its Uyghur population and the Indicator warrants a 2 score.
Foreign Policy.note: Greece has not adopted an official position on Xinjiang and the Uyghur issue. It should be noticed, however, that the leftist Greek government of SYRIZA vetoed a European Union condemnation of China’s human rights record, back in 2017.
Foreign Policy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

"No evidence can be found of Greece taking a definitive position regarding this Indicator. Therefore, Greece has remained silent regarding the PRC’s ongoing repression in Hong Kong and the Indicator warrants a 2 score.
"
Foreign Policy.note: Greece has not distanced itself from EU statements on Honk Kong. However, on several occasions over the past few years, Greece opted for abstaining from statements critical of China on Hong Kong at UN level.

Academia.evidence: In July 2021, the University of the Peloponnese annouced its cooperation with the Huawei ICT Academy. In December 2021, the University of Western Macedonia announced a cooperation agreement with the Huawei ICT Academy. In May 2022, the Aristotle University of Thessaloniki (AUTh) signed an agreement with Huawei for cooperation with the Huawei ICT Academy on the following subjects taught at AUTh: ΑΙ; ΙοΤ; Cloud Computing; Big Data; Wireless Networks; Security of IT Systems; 5G Technologies; Data Communications, Routing and Switching. Again in May 2022, Huawei granted 27 Seeds for the Future scholarships to students from 8 Greek universities: The Aristotle University of Thessaloniki, the National Polytechnic University, the Athens University of Economics and Business, the University of Thessaly, the University of Crete, the University of Macedonia (Thessaloniki), the University of Patras and the University of Piraeus. Additionally, in July 2022, Huawei Signed a three-year MoU with the National Technical University of Athens for the cooperation in the field of education. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "More than a few" rating. Such cooperations set the foundations of wider Chinese influence on Greek Universities, something that can potentially lead to the enhancement of China's political influence in Greece. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence:
"There are Confucius institutes at:

- the Athens University of Economics and Business 
- the Aristotle University of Thessaloniki
- the University of Thessaly
- the Greek University of West Attica.
Additionally, there is a cooperation program between the Technical University of Crete and the Center for Language Education and Cooperation of China. In comparison with other EU member, four such entities are not that many. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a ""Few"" rating. Still, such cooperations can be utilized for the strategic promotion of a positive Chinese image and the formulation of further cooperations between Greece and China, thus increasing the latters presence and influence in the former. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a ""Significant"" rating."
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There are two schools, Aristotle University of Thessaloniki and University of Thessaly, which are members of the Belt and Road Architectural University International Consortium (BRAUIC). Therefore, this Indicator deserves a ""Few"" rating. No noticable BRAUIC activity is observed in Greece. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an ""Insignificant"" rating.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Academia.evidence: There have been several joint activities between Greek and Chinese research and academic institutions, with China's Embassy in Greece also being active in co-organizing such events. While it's likely that Chinese entities do occasionally provide financial benefits to the aforementioned Greek institutions, there is no public evidence to support this claim. Therefore, while the local experts have observed the Indicator phenomena, they cannot provide the necessary documentary evidence to answer the Indicator in the affirmative.
Academia.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

This development could potentially lead Chinese recruitment programs to target Greek academia.

Domestic Politics.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Domestic Politics.note: One reservation regarding this question is that twinning agreements are not always reported and their content often remains obscure. Additionally, there are some indicative examples which suggest that China may target government and potentially sub-government officials, in order to promote agreements. In 2018, the Municipality of the Greek city of Kalamata, had signed a contract with the Greek telecommunications company "Wind" for the establishment of a 5G network, provided by Huawei. This project, however, wasn't supported by the Municipality alone and was promoted by then leftist government of SYRIZA. It was canceled after the intervention of the US government, which issued a national security concern on a European level that led to the banning of Huawei from the European Internet network and 5G services. It should also be noted, that, in 2018, Huawei was assigned with the project of modernizing the Port of Piraeus Authority (PPA) network infrastructure, establishing a private network. Even though the above cases do not apply to the parameters of the indicator, they constitute indicative examples of China's attempts to approach politicians and members of the sub-national government in order to promote its agendas, revealing also the fact that technology is a major 'tool' for said policy.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence:
"There are several reported sister-city/province ties between Greece and China (respective list below). Therefore, this Indicator deserves a ""More than a few"" rating. However, those agreements/ties were mostly created in a framework of formality between the two countries, and bare little political or economic gravity. Therefore this Indicator deserves an ""Insignificant"" rating.

Respective list of Greek and Chinese sister cities/provinces:

- Athens - Beijing
- Amaroussion Municipality - Chaoyang district (Beijing)
- Chalandri Municipality - Habin
- Corfu - Tai'an
- Elefsina - Xicheng district (Beijing)
- Kalamata - Xi'an
- Patras - Wuxi
- Piraeus - Shanghai
- Trikala - Banan distict (Chongqing Municipality)
- Chios - Jiujiang
- Chalcis - Wuhan
- Marathon - Xiamen, Danzhou
- Thessaloniki - Tianjin, Shenyang, Dongguan
- Lefkada - Zhoushan
- Tinos - Zhoushan
- Tripolis - Guiyang
- Sparta - Miyun district (Beijing)
- Gortyna Municipality (Crete) - Chaoyang district (Beijing)
- Attica Province - Sichuan Province
- Crete Provinces - Hainan Province
- Peloponnese Provinces - Qinghai Province
- Pieria Povince - Shandong Province"
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: While there are no reports to suggest that Greek politicians or government employees have taken trips to China paid by PRC entities, it's not implausible that something like this has taken place without it being publicly known. Therefore, a definite answer to this Indicator cannot be provided.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: While Greek politicians and government employees at the local level seldom pay official visits to China, PRC official in Greece, especially the Chinese Ambassador Xiao Junzheng, often meets such officials. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "More than a few" rating. Additionally, the frequency of those meetings are accompanied by what is assessed to be a Chinese strategy to establish ties, not only with the Greek government, but also with local provincial and municipal authorities, thus forming a multilevel framework of influence in Greece. Therefore, the Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Domestic Politics.evidence: Greek political party representatives' visits in the PRC and their attendance in IDCPC or other events organized by Chinese state entities is a well established fact, but the frequency of such cases is relatively low. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. However, in several of those visits and attendancies Greece is represented by high ranking officials, with the current Greek Prime Minister having visited China twice in the past five years after being officially invited to discuss bilateral cooperation. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Domestic Politics.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: The main Greek extractive products are Mineral fuels (including refined petroleum), marble, travertine, alabaster, several key industrial minerals, like bentonite, magnesite, and perlite, and some precious metal ores. While China appears to be, by far, the major importer of greek marble, travertine and alabaster, that is not the case for the rest extractive goods. According to recent evidence, Lebanon is the main importer of Greek refined petroleum, and the US of Greek industrial minerals. Since China is not "the top" buyer, but "a top" buyer, the most appropriate answer to this indicator would be "No".
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Economy.evidence: China onws 67% of the Piraeus Port Authority stocks through COSCO Shiping, 24% of Independent Power Transmission Operator (IPTO) through State Grid, and 75% equity of four wind farms in Northern Greece through China Energy Europe Renewable Energy S.A.(CEERE). Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Economy.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: There had been agreements between the Chinese Telecommunications company Huawei for the establishment of 5G networks with the Vodafone Hellas in the Greek city of Trikala and with Wind Hellas in Kalamata. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. However, those agreements were blocked before being realised. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Technology.note: It should be noted that Vodafone has in fact established a private mobile network for the Piraeus Port Authority in Greece. Additionally, Huawei provides ICT infrastructure for the terminals of the port, making the cooperation of the two on a 5G or 4G network possible.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: Chinese Internet and Communication Tecnhnologies companies ZTE and Xiaomi hardware, connected to internet services (mainly routers), is used by the chief internet providers in Greece (OTE-Cosmote, Vodafone and Wind), as is evidenced by their e-shops. A similar example would be the smaller Greek internet provider Inalan, that cooperates with ZTE in internet services using ZTE and Huawei routers. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" rating. Although few, the aforementioned companies are included in China's top internet providers. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: The Chinese companies ZPMC and Nuctech are two indicative examples of Chinese tech-related equipment providers that have supplied critical Greek infrustructures. Therefore this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: There aren't many examples of PRC-connected venture capital investments or PRC-affiliated financial firms that invest or buy out Greek technology start-ups. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. However, the fact that China targets some of Greek technology start-ups, indicates that it aims to acquire or even usurp foreign technological data, patents and know-how, in order to promote state strategies, utilization of dual-use technologies for military development. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significant" rating.
Technology.note: The Greek programme 'Enterprise Greece' is seeking to attract more foreign investment for Greek enterprices, including start-ups. China is featured as a promising investment partner as one of the major Asia ICT markets.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Technology.evidence: Through a limited number of investments, and a larger number of MoUs, Chinese companies have a certain presence in certain innovation sectors in Greece. Although this presence is not extensive. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. This limited presence exerts little influence over the Greek entrepreneurship. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Technology.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: Most Chinese associations in Greece target the expansion of cooperation between the two countries on an economic, cultural and political level, with very few examples of Taiwan reunification promotion, with Greece-China Peaceful Reunification Promotion Association being the only found reported example. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. There is no further evidence of the aforementioned association's, or any other entities', active role in promoting China-Taiwan reunification in Greece. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: The Hellenic-Chinese Union for Economical Commercial and Cultural, is an association founded in Greece in 2007 and formally established in 2008. The Union aims at forming bilateral relations with Chinese organizations, like, among others, the United World Chinese Association. Given the eagerness of Chinese associations with world-wide activity to include local unions and groups, it would be safe to suggest that the Hellenic-Chinese Union for Economical Commercial and Cultural is a member of United World Chinese Association. Nevertheless, there is lack of sufficient evidence and noticable activity on behalf of the Hellenic-Chinese Union since 2014. Therefore, a definite answer to this Indicator cannot be provided.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: Such events, organised by Chinese entities and China's diplomatic represantation in Greece are relatively few. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. However, such events are used as a major soft power practice to PRC social and political infiltration strategy. Additionaly, it should be noted that these events are often attended by Greek officials. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Significnat" rating.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Society.note: While some PRC-connected professional associations, like the All-China Journalists Association and China Artists Association, have visited Greece, there is no indication of close ties with relative Greek entities.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: A recent donation of $100.000 by the Chinese to the Greek Red Cross, constitutes an indicative example of Chinese donations to vulnerable sector, like medical care. Through such actions China attempts to establish relationships on both an institutional and individual-to-individual level. These relationships can be easily manipulated, in order to promote Chinese interests on several occasions. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: The National Theatre of China and the Sino-Hellenic Performing Arts Alliance are conducting their first joint endeavour in Greece, with the presence of entertainment venues being limited in Greece. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. While there is some attempt for the increase of relevant venues, in order to strengthen the promotion of Chinese culture in Greece, the endeavours remain limited and, for the time being, of little impact. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: TikTok is the only Chinese social media with significant presence in Greece, ranking third in preference after Fecebook and Instagram. It should be noted, however, that TikTok is becoming a rising trend, especially for the younger Greek audience. Therefore, this indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: Such events, organised by Chinese entities and China's diplomatic represantation in Greece are several and increasing in number. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "More than a few" rating. However, they usually revolve around Chinese aspects, like caligraphy, tradition and martial arts, and aim to the standard promotion of Chinese culture. Therefore. this indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Society.note: Chinese Cultural associations in Greece are, likely, also recipients of PRC funding. However, the reported evidence are scarce.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: There is no observation of the indicator phenomenon.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Society.evidence: The COVID-19 pandemic and the repression of human rights by the Chinese government have significantly reduced Greece's favorable public opinion toward China and its President, Xi Jinping. Nevertheless, the majority of Greek citizens still view China under a relatively positive view, mostly due to its ancient civilization promotion. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Society.note: However, the COVID-19 pandemic has reduced significantly Greece's favorable public opinion on China and its President, Xi Jinping. Beijing's repressive policies toward human rights have also contributed to the gradually decreasing favorable Greek view toward the Chinese government. Additionally, there is a growing displeasure of the Piraeus local community toward COSCO's activity in the Port.
Society.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Military.evidence: Although there are no reported cases of Greek retired or active military or intelligence officers receiving direct or deferred benefits from PRC-connected individuals or entities, there are reports that China is recruiting former NATO-member military officers, like combat pilots, throught companies likned to the PLA (example: Test Flying Academy of South Africa - TFASA). Given the fact that Greece is a NATO country, it would not be unlikely for its military personnel to have been targeted by China via similar methods Therefore, a definite answer to this Indicator cannot be provided.

Law Enforcement.evidence: In 1994 Greece and China signed a Bilateral Convention of Judicial Assistance, which was ratified in 1995. Additionally, Greece and Chine signed a collection of 16 MoUs in 2019, among them one dealing with extradition. However, no extradition treaty as such has been ratified. Therefore, the indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Law Enforcement.evidence: A Sino-Greek Police Cooperation Agreement was signed in 2007. The agreement enables mutual cooperation of the competent police authorities on the following sectors: terrorism, organized crime, drug trafficking, illegal weapon distribution (including chemical, biological and radiobiological weapons), human trafficking, smuggling and economic crime (including laundering), tracking missing and wanted persons, art and historical/cultural artifacts trafficking/smuggling, mutual training programs and police academies personel/trainees exchanges for further education. The last sector has not been applied up to 2023. Moreover, it should be clarified that any cooperation is restricted on intelligence exchange between the competent Sino-Greek authorities only, no  involvement or intervention in either country's police affairs is authorized by the agreement. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Law Enforcement.evidence: While the existance of PRC-connected gangs in Greece has not been officially confirmed, organized Chinese criminal activity (Chinese mafia) has been reported. It is highly possible that the aforementioned activity is actually linked to the PRC, with gangs operating under Chinese government instructions.However, it has not been proven conclusively. Therefore, a definite answer to this Indicator cannot be provided.

Law Enforcement.evidence: The only reported case that indicates the realisation of such activity, is a Police Cooperation Agreement between China and Greece, signed in 2007, which includes training and exchanges between Greek and Chinese politce Academies. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Few" rating. However, the aformentioned cooperation is, for the time being, limited to informative presentations, with no report of joint operational police training between the two countries. Therefore, this Indicator deserves an "Insignificant" rating.
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Law Enforcement.note: While there are no reported cases of such activity by local criminal groups, there is some alleged presence of Chinese mafia cells in Greece, who proceed in coercive, intimidating and punitive tactics, possibly even resulting in murder. Nevertheless, it should be made perfectly clear that such activity is targeted towards Chinese individuals residing in Greece.The reasons behind any possible harassment vary, and may definately include dissidence and the adoption of a critical disposition towards the PRC by member of the Chinese diaspora.
Law Enforcement.answerer: Answered by 1 anonymous expert, and has been reviewed by another 1 anonymous expert.

Law Enforcement.evidence: Some indicators suggest that Greece has become a target of cyberattacks, especially after the Russian invasion of Ukraine, since it is a NATO member. However, there is not enough evidence in order to attribute those cyberattacks to PRC affiliated groups. Therefore, a definite answer to this Indicator cannot be provided.”

Law Enforcement.evidence: There has been a reported case of an Overseas Police Service Station operating in Greece, surveying, detaining and harassing members of the Chinese diaspora. Therefore, this Indicator deserves a "Yes" response.

Law Enforcement.note: It should be noted that there have been reported cases of Chinese nationals being extradited back to China by the Greek authorities. However, these cases haven't raise criticism by politicians, government employees, NGOs, or other entities, since they refer to individuals who are found guilty of certain crimes and violations (in most cases economic fraud or other related financial crimes) and against whom there have been issued international arrest warrants.
